data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step in the direction you are facing is to face the right and take 10 steps forward. Then the first step is backwards to become the right and it is 10 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 4 steps and turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn right. Turn around and turn right. So, the answer is No.

The instructions work equally if you do the steps 4 steps and the starting point is at 6 steps. One must take four steps to return to the starting point and 10 steps then turn around. So, the answer is yes.

Take 1 step back and 7 step further to go to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You can't return to the starting point until you make a circle around it. If you want to turn left again, you can't turn right, because you would be bringing the circular movement up to right. So, the answer is No.

After going forward, you' re facing to NEFT and moving out to RIGHT. After going in that direction, you' re not facing to NEFT and moving out TO RIGHT. So, the answer is No.

There are eight ways to get from one place to another. If someone always faces forward then they will make a right turn and go up the street so that they are facing the start of the street so that they would find it easier to get back on the road to the starting point. Taking 7 steps backward is one way of going back to where you started the round trip. If you always facing right then you would take 10 steps for the first 15 yards of the round trip. If you always facing left then you would take 9 steps left for the first 25 yards of the round trip. Thus, the answer is No.
